name: datisi
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w0, w2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w0, w2))

stmt.origin: mpbi(wex(s0, wa(w0, w2)), wex(s0, wa(w2, w0)))

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w2))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, w0))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w2, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, w0))
-| wb(wex(s0, wa(w2, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w2)))

body.origin: |- wb(wex(s0, wa(w2, w0)), wex(s0, wa(w0, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, w1))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, w1))
-| wex(s0, wa(w2, w0))

comment: "Datisi", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. All ` ph ` is ` ps ` , and some ` ph ` is ` ch ` , therefore some ` ch ` is ` ps ` . In Aristotelian notation, AII-3: MaP and MiS therefore SiP. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.) Shorten and reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)
